menace.translation[0].definitions[0].def: something or someone that is dangerous
menace.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: the growing menace of oil pollution at sea
It’s the only way to deal with the menace of drug dealing.
That man’s a menace to society. He should be locked away.
menace.translation[0].definitions[1].def: a threatening quality, feeling, or way of behaving
menace.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: There was menace in his voice.
There was a sense of menace as the sky grew darker.
menace.translation[0].definitions[2].def: a person, especially a child, who is annoying or causes trouble
menace.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: My little brother’s a real menace.
menace.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: The elephants are still menaced by poachers.
menace.translation[2].definitions[0].exa: Many people think that overseas competition is the biggest menace to the industry.
